events.message: Customer reported that their car was involved in a collision with another vehicle at a busy intersection. Immediate claim filing requested.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords referring to vehicle collision and damages.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the auto accident case reported by the customer.
The insurance team formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that their case is being processed.
Customer was asked to submit police reports, damage photos, and repair estimates to support the claim investigation.
Customer provided all requested documents including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a mechanic's repair quote.
The investigation team started assessing the collected evidence to validate the claim and determine coverage.
Investigation concluded with findings that the collision was partly due to the other driver’s negligence.
Based on investigation results, the insurance company proposed a fair settlement amount covering most of the repair costs.
Customer responded with appreciation for the prompt settlement proposal and confirmed acceptance of the offer.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment was disbursed to the customer’s nominated bank account to cover the approved vehicle repair expenses.
The claim file was closed after confirming payment issuance and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
All documentation and investigation details were securely archived for future reference and compliance requirements.
